intro: Forcipella rugelii, commonly known as the rugel's false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbel-like clusters during the spring season. Forcipella rugelii is adapted to cold and arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine flora and ecological adaptations.
